column4: is there a way I can select to use the security update kernel image vs. the current kernel image?
when you update kernels from the repositories, there are usually entries in the grub menu that allow you to boot from the old ones
i want to boot form the newer one by default
for some reason it is not default
ok, have you modified /boot/grub/menu.lst at all ?  It is usually set to boot from the first entry and new entries are added to the top of the list
nope i have not modified it
hmmk.  Put it on a pastebin.
i dont even seem to have aone have a menu.1st
dont have one*
/boot/grub/menu.lst  ?
note that the first character in lst is lowercase L
doesnt exist
did you see that last post from me? the first character in lst is lowercase L
sudo update-alternatives --config java
thanks mate
np :)
System -> Preferences -> Sessions, Startup Programs tab ?
dont have X working
ah
Perhaps something in ~/.config/autostart/
thanks a ton!
ooh good, that worked.  np :)
